body:
It seems like fix for #133 in commit ff3d3b34 caused that problem.
If found at least on windows new File (last line) in determineOutputFile method removes the trailing slash.

https://github.com/srikanth-lingala/zip4j/blob/ed9eed54de22cb845ded8d582b7330adcc7ba9af/src/main/java/net/lingala/zip4j/tasks/AbstractExtractFileTask.java#L165

new File("d:\test\2\) --> d:\test

In fix #133 you have added a file seperator to the extraction path in order somone can not extract in a different folder name. Unfortunatly the result of determineOutputFile does not contain a slash in case its the relative root folder.

https://github.com/srikanth-lingala/zip4j/blob/ed9eed54de22cb845ded8d582b7330adcc7ba9af/src/main/java/net/lingala/zip4j/tasks/AbstractExtractFileTask.java#L52

@Gr33nbl00d Thanks for the PR. I merged your PR, but also made some [slight adjustment to your PR][1]. Instead of checking for just root directory, I now check if the outputFile is a directory, and append the fileSeparator if it is a directory. Can you please confirm if this change still works with your zip file?

[1]: https://github.com/srikanth-lingala/zip4j/commit/db41e9b47c82d728b66e9209a66cd00fa4aa52c0#diff-3f214bfe1a60439ad4cafcb2c9b107e031119da12a53d576b4ea9b8a80838756R75
I will check on wednesday if it still works. I have a day off tomorrow. Thanks for merging
Hi i have verified that the bugfix fixed the problem :)
I think that #402 fixed a security vulnerability, is that indeed correct? If so, this should probably have a CVE assigned to it? Do you agree?

Friendly ping to the Snky team:

 - Benji @benjifin
 - Leeya @leeyashalti

issue.title: Did this fix a security vulnerability?

repository.name: zip4j
repository.description: A Java library for zip files and streams

issue.body:
https://github.com/srikanth-lingala/zip4j/issues/400

Reaching out to ask if this fixed a security vulnerability, or was it just a bug? If it was a bug, do you need assistance with vulnerability disclosure and getting a CVE number assigned?
